ans.reasoning: This method checks if the method is abstract and throws an exception if it is. Since the test is trying to call a real method on an abstract class, this method is directly related to the failure.

This method throws a MockitoException indicating that calling real methods on abstract classes is not allowed. It is relevant to the failure but is more of a response to the issue rather than the cause.

This method attempts to call the real method on a mock. Since the test is trying to call a real method on an abstract class, this method is suspicious as it directly relates to the invocation of the real method.
This method creates a spy of the class. While it is involved in the mocking process, it does not directly cause the failure related to calling an abstract method.
This method sets up mock settings but does not directly relate to the failure of calling a real method on an abstract class. It is the least suspicious in this context.
